If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
forums.

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
If you are submitting a bug report, please fill in the following details.

Issue description

I've built pytorch on aarch64 and in specific a Jetson TX2 from source, using:

git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git
cd pytorch
git checkout -b v0.1.10 v0.1.10
sudo python3 setup.py install

The compilation goes fine, and I then install pytorch system wide without any problems.
The TX2 is L4T R28.0 with Cuda 9.0 and cuDNN 6.0.

Code example

Trying to test pytorch with cuda gives a mix of messages. Whereas CUDA appears supported, cuDNN throws a warning of the library not found.
The library is under $LD_LIBRARY_PATH, it is seen by ldconfig and does exist in the syste.

ubuntu@tegra-ubuntu:~$ python3
Python 3.5.2 (default, Nov 23 2017, 16:37:01) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> print(torch.cuda.is_available())
True
>>> print(torch.cuda.device_count())
1
>>> torch.backends.cudnn.is_acceptable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1))
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py:60: UserWarning: cuDNN library not found. Check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH
  }.get(sys.platform, 'LD_LIBRARY_PATH')))
False
>>>

I followed the instructions from this repository should I assume I need a newer cuDNN?

#edit: I've now tried with cuDNN 7 and I'm still getting the same error. Bear in mind that TX2 has cuda and cuDNN under /usr/lib/aarch64-linux-gnu

body:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
[forums](https://discuss.pytorch.org/).

If you are submitting a feature request, please preface the title with [feature request].
If you are submitting a bug report, please fill in the following details.

## Issue description

I've built pytorch on `aarch64` and in specific a Jetson TX2 from source, using:
```
git clone https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch.git
cd pytorch
git checkout -b v0.1.10 v0.1.10
sudo python3 setup.py install
```

The compilation goes fine, and I then install pytorch system wide without any problems.
The TX2 is L4T R28.0 with Cuda 9.0 and cuDNN 6.0.

## Code example

Trying to test pytorch with cuda gives a mix of messages. Whereas CUDA appears supported, cuDNN throws a warning of the library not found.
The library is under `$LD_LIBRARY_PATH`, it is seen by `ldconfig` and does exist in the syste.

```
ubuntu@tegra-ubuntu:~$ python3
Python 3.5.2 (default, Nov 23 2017, 16:37:01) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
>>> print(torch.cuda.is_available())
True
>>> print(torch.cuda.device_count())
1
>>> torch.backends.cudnn.is_acceptable(torch.cuda.FloatTensor(1))
/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py:60: UserWarning: cuDNN library not found. Check your LD_LIBRARY_PATH
  }.get(sys.platform, 'LD_LIBRARY_PATH')))
False
>>> 
```

I followed the instructions from this [repository](https://github.com/andrewadare/jetson-tx2-pytorch) should I assume I need a newer cuDNN?

#edit: I've now tried with cuDNN 7 and I'm still getting the same error. Bear in mind that TX2 has cuda and cuDNN under `/usr/lib/aarch64-linux-gnu`
